name: Samarjit Chakraborty
content: Samarjit Chakraborty's webpage Samarjit Chakraborty I am with the Computer Science Department of UNC Chapel Hill and a member of the Real-Time Systems Group. My research interests span across real-time, embedded, and cyber-physical systems design. A brief bio and contact information may be found here. News Jul 2023: Research Panel at DAC 2023: "Achieving Verifiable Autonomy: Is Design Automation the Golden Key?" Mar 2023: Special issue on Automotive CPS Safety & Security in the ACM Transactions on Cyber-Physical Systems is now available. Feb 2023: Special session on "Autonomy-driven Emerging Directions in Software-defined Vehicles" (with General Motors and Siemens) at DATE 2023 (as part of the Initiative on Autonomous Systems Design) Dec 2022: Special issue on Embedded Systems for Computer Vision in the Leibniz Transactions on Embedded Systems is now available. Aug 2022: Statistical Hypothesis Testing of Controller Implementations under Timing Uncertainties nominated for Best Paper Award at RTCSA 2022 Mar 2022: BMC+Fuzz: Efficient and Effective Test Generation nominated for Best Paper Award at DATE 2022 Feb 2022: Enrico Fraccaroli joins us as a Postdoctoral Researcher from the University of Verona Jan 2022: Smartphone-based Electronic Contact Tracing for COVID-19 featured as the Communications of the ACM cover article Oct 2021: Our Special Issue on Cross-Layer Design of Cyber-Physical Systems in IEEE Design & Test is now available. See introduction to the special issue [pdf] Oct 2021: TECS 2021 Best Paper Award for: Energy Modeling for the Bluetooth Low Energy Protocol. Philipp H. Kindt, Daniel Yunge, Robert Diemer, and Samarjit Chakraborty. ACM Transactions on Embedded Computing Systems, Volume 19, Issue 2, March 2020 Aug 2021: Shengjie Xu and Sharmin Aktar start their PhD Jun 2021: Paper on Smartphone-based Electronic Contact Tracing for COVID-19 accepted to Communications of the ACM May 2021: Submissions are being invited to a Special Issue on Automotive CPS Safety & Security at the ACM Transactions on Cyber-Physical Systems (submission deadline: July 01, 2021, please submit your work) Jan 2021: Nominations are being invited for the 2021 ACM SIGBED Early Career Researcher Award (deadline: March 15, 2021, new procedures for this year). Consider nominating your former PhD students, postdocs, or junior colleagues! Jan 2021: New NSF project on automotive CPS started from Jan 01, 2021 Jan 2021: Session on Predictable Perception in Autonomous Systems at the Special Initiative on Autonomous Systems Design on Fri, Feb 05, at DATE 2021 (Registration is FREE, please attend!) Oct 2020: New paper on neighbor discovery in IEEE TMC Jun 2020: Submissions are being invited to a Special Issue on Embedded Systems for Computer Vision at the Leibniz Transactions on Embedded Systems (deadline: Dec 15, 2020, contact guest editors if extensions are necesaary) May 2020: How Reliable is Smartphone-based Electronic Contact Tracing for COVID-19? Mar 2020: CPS-oriented Modeling and and Control of Traffic Signals Using Adaptive Back Pressure nominated for Best Paper Award at DATE 2020 Jan 2020: Our paper Energy Modeling for the Bluetooth Low Energy Protocol accepted to the ACM Trans. on Embedded Computing Systems (TECS) Jan 2020: Our Special Issue on Transportation Cyber-Physical Systems in ACM Trans. on Cyber-Physical Systems (TCPS) Nov 2019: Nominations are being invited for the 2020 ACM SIGBED Early Career Researcher Award (deadline: January 15, 2020). Consider nominating your former PhD students, postdocs, or junior colleagues!
